Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as de2a132aee45d077e83f59ede182a6fb73613aeb

are we not handling Entity Association PDR for the sensors ?
without the association information we will not be able to relate the which sensor belongs to which Container. We might also want to publish this Entity association over dbus so that the SensorID/Value pair can be mapped.

The design of mapping sensor according to Entity Association PDR is not covered by current PLDM document yet(https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/docs/+/47252).

For now, the current implementation of sensor association over dbus is simply mapping the sensors under the same terminus.

terminus.cpp registers a inventory/Item/Board D-Bus interface for itself and then numeric_sensor.cpp associates itself to terminus.

Can we rename PLDM_PLATFORM to PLDM_PLATFORM_MC (Monitoring and Control type) ?

Renaming the existing define would introduce a lot code changes because the define has been used by other files(e.g. /libpldm/platform.c, /libpldmresponder/base.cpp, /pldmtool/pldm_base_cmd.cpp and pldmd.cpp)

Any plan to move this API to libpldm? @Tom do you think it will be useful for libpldm consumers.

I don't have plan to move it to libpldm for now.
Please let me know if it is suggested to be part of libpldm. I will convert its implementation from C++ to C.
I think we can move this libpldm later. When we have enough time to verify the function with multiple system with multiple PDR configuration types.

There are chances of having currupted PDRs. So we need to make sure an incorrect PDR is not causing invalid pointer access. Basically we need to check pdr size is valid based on sensor_data_size and range_field_format before we start memcpy.

@Thu, I had a question, so using this support you were able to request the getPDRs and wait for the repo change event from the host? How was it tested? Tested in your systems? If yes, can we have something pasted as output here in the commit message?
Few minor comments, but overall it looks good :)

> @Thu, I had a question, so using this support you were able to request the getPDRs 

Yes, we can request all PDRs from the discovered termini.

> and wait for the repo change event from the host?

No, the PDRs change event from termini is not supported in this patch set. Feel free to add the handling for that event.

> How was it tested? Tested in your systems? If yes, can we have > something pasted as output here in the commit message?
> Few minor comments, but overall it looks good :)

The Unit test is added to verify about the PDR parser.
The patch set is tested in Ampere system and some other OEMs are also using this patch set with their system and they confirmed that PDR handling worked.

Need create the define constant for this value. This is max BMC receive buffer size for on PLDM message.

Add `maximum-receive-size` build options to allow set the max received buffer size of the response for one PLDM command. Min value is 512 and Max value is 4096 bytes.

The default value is 1024.

`std::u16string u16NameString(alignedBuffer, u16NameStringLen);` can we not do this like a regular string ? whats the significance of 0 here ?

We can't  treat `u16NameString` as a regular string because it is u16string. The terminator is u"" (0x00 0x00).
0 is used to set the u16NameString[u16NameStringLen + 1] as terminator. I updated the code to include terminator in alignedBuffer.

why do we need to replace spaces with _ ? it is mentioned in the spec anywhere ?
The sensor name will be used to create sensor D-Bus interface. So ` ` has to be replace by `_` to meet with D-Bus object path requirement.
